crops.name: Carrot (short/early, pot-suitable)
crops.where: Deep pots, raised beds, direct soil
crops.protection: Fine mesh/fleece 60cm high against carrot fly; avoid bruising foliage
crops.tips: Use short-rooted types for containers; thin at dusk; keep evenly moist to prevent splitting
crops.notes: Succession sow every 3–4 weeks for continuous harvest

crops.name: Carrot (maincrop)
crops.protection: Carrot fly mesh; water in dry spells
crops.tips: Do not over-fertilise; forked roots come from stones or fresh manure
crops.notes: Store in sand or leave in ground with fleece into winter

crops.name: Beetroot
crops.protection: Fleece in early spring
crops.tips: Multi-germ seeds produce clusters—thin to one strong seedling; harvest golf-ball size for tenderness
crops.notes: Leaves edible in salads; water to prevent woody roots

crops.name: Radish (spring)
crops.protection: Flea beetle mesh in warm spells
crops.tips: Fast—harvest 4–5 weeks from sowing; keep moist to avoid peppery pithy roots
crops.notes: Great gap-filler between slower crops

crops.name: Radish (winter/daikon)
crops.protection: Fleece against flea beetle; water to encourage steady growth
crops.tips: Sow late summer for autumn harvest; thin early
crops.notes: Mild flavour; good for pickling

crops.name: Turnip (salad/mini)
crops.protection: Mesh against flea beetle
crops.tips: Harvest golf-ball size (Hakurei-types) for sweetness
crops.notes: Leaves (turnip greens) are edible

crops.name: Turnip (maincrop)
crops.protection: Net for flea beetle and pigeons
crops.tips: Water consistently to avoid woody roots
crops.notes: Good winter keeper varieties available

crops.name: Swede (rutabaga)
crops.protection: Net against flea beetle and pigeons
crops.tips: Needs long season; firm soil; thin early
crops.notes: Better in ground than pots, but large tubs can work

crops.name: Parsnip
crops.protection: Fleece early to warm soil
crops.tips: Use fresh seed; do not transplant; lift after frost for sweetness
crops.notes: Slow to germinate—can take 3–4 weeks

crops.name: Celeriac
crops.protection: Fleece in spring; slug control
crops.tips: Start indoors early; keep crown exposed; steady moisture is essential
crops.notes: Feed regularly; remove outer leaves to swell the crown

crops.name: Salsify
crops.protection: Fleece early; keep weed-free
crops.tips: Do not transplant; lift carefully to avoid breakage
crops.notes: Delicate, oyster-like flavour

crops.name: Scorzonera
crops.protection: Fleece early; minimal disturbance
crops.tips: Similar to salsify; keep moist for straight roots
crops.notes: Peel under water to avoid staining

crops.name: Kohlrabi
crops.protection: Net against pigeons and flea beetle
crops.tips: Harvest tennis-ball size for tenderness
crops.notes: Technically a swollen stem; treated as a root crop here

crops.name: Daikon/Mooli (long white radish)
crops.protection: Flea beetle mesh; water to prevent bolting
crops.tips: Late summer sowing avoids bolting and flea beetle
crops.notes: Great for fermenting and salads

crops.name: Potato (first earlies)
crops.protection: Earth up; fleece for late frosts; blight watch
crops.tips: Chit tubers 2–4 weeks; water well as tubers form
crops.notes: Fastest harvest; great in containers

crops.name: Potato (second earlies & salad)
crops.protection: Earth up; blight control in wet summers
crops.tips: Consistent watering reduces scab and splits
crops.notes: Good continuity after first earlies

crops.name: Potato (maincrop)
crops.protection: Earth up; blight monitoring; lift before heavy frost
crops.tips: Cure skins before storage; store cool and dark
crops.notes: Best in ground for bulk yields

crops.name: Sweet potato (warm, container)
crops.protection: Black mulch, fleece early; protect from cold nights
crops.tips: Use short-season varieties; keep moist and warm
crops.notes: Borderline outdoors; best under cover in much of England

crops.name: Jerusalem artichoke
crops.where: Beds/soil; can be grown in large tubs
crops.protection: Shelter from wind; very tall
crops.tips: Harvest after frost for sweeter flavour; invasive if not contained
crops.notes: Perennial; lift thoroughly to prevent spread

crops.name: Ginger (container, indoors)
crops.protection: Keep above 15°C; avoid waterlogging
crops.tips: Use fresh, sprouting rhizomes; keep humid
crops.notes: Edible fresh stem (young) and rhizome
